intro: Hieracium racemosum subsp. sublateriflorum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowering stems are usually branched, bearing clusters of yellowish to orange flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its leaf shape and the arrangement of its inflorescence.
